page.title: 09TECHNOLOGY.
page.content: {TECHNOLOGY ON OWSTON FARMS { __________________________ The harvesting of grass for silage, and of straw for bedding, has been revolutionised by the introduction of a big_baler. Several farms possess tractors that are not only powerful but complex: spikes to move big bales, loaders to move material or clean cattle yards. They pull four furrow reversible ploughs which allow rapid autumn cultivations. Two farms possess combine harvesters. Two specialist grain stores, and four purpose-built cattleyards have been erected. Several farms have mills to roll barley for stock feed. One farmer uses electric fencing to contain his stock and the dairy farmer has an electric milking parlour. Pesticides and fungicides are used when necessary.
